meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The elizaOS ecosystem is preparing for a critical token migration from AI16Z to ElizaOS on November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio, while simultaneously advancing core technical features and improvements to agent capabilities.

key_points.summary: The upcoming AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration (1:6 ratio) on November 7th requires clear communication about exchange support and manual migration procedures during the 90-day window to ensure a smooth transition for all stakeholders.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize our communication efforts around the token migration to maximize community understanding and participation?
context: AI16Z tokens will migrate to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS)
Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations
Official information about which exchanges support automatic migration will be shared on Friday

answer_1.text: Focus on creating a comprehensive migration guide and FAQ document that addresses all possible edge cases.
answer_1.implication: Creates a central resource but risks information overload and may not reach users who don't actively seek information.

answer_2.text: Prioritize exchange partnerships to maximize automatic migrations, focusing communication on the minority who need manual processes.
answer_2.implication: Minimizes friction for most users but could create confusion if exchange support doesn't materialize as expected.

answer_3.text: Implement a multi-channel approach with simplified messaging, direct notifications, and interactive support channels during the migration period.
answer_3.implication: Ensures wider reach but requires more resources to maintain consistent messaging across channels.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What measures should be implemented to mitigate potential market volatility during the migration period?
context: Some users debating whether to buy more AI16Z before migration or wait
Lighter (perps dex) will not support AI16Z after migration; listing ElizaOS is at their discretion

answer_1.text: Pursue aggressive liquidity provider incentives for the new token to ensure depth from day one.
answer_1.implication: Stabilizes trading but requires significant capital allocation that could be used elsewhere in the ecosystem.

answer_2.text: Implement a phased migration approach where only a percentage of tokens can be migrated each week to spread out potential selling pressure.
answer_2.implication: Smooths volatility but increases migration complexity and may frustrate users wanting immediate access.

answer_3.text: Focus on securing strategic exchange listings and maintain transparent communication about market dynamics without direct intervention.
answer_3.implication: Respects market forces while building infrastructure for long-term success, but accepts potential short-term volatility.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage the token migration to drive engagement with auto.fun and other ecosystem products?
context: Moca launching 10k Eliza agents (mentioned by Reneil)
AI events on Luma.com discussed as potential opportunities for user onboarding and investor presentations

answer_1.text: Create migration incentives that reward users for simultaneously engaging with auto.fun or other ecosystem products.
answer_1.implication: Drives cross-product adoption but risks diluting the migration message with complex incentive structures.

answer_2.text: Separate the migration completely from product marketing to ensure clarity, then launch targeted product campaigns after migration completion.
answer_2.implication: Maintains message clarity but misses the opportunity of heightened community attention during the migration period.

answer_3.text: Use the migration as a narrative inflection point to highlight the broader vision, with showcases of agent capabilities timed to coincide with migration milestones.
answer_3.implication: Creates a cohesive ecosystem story but requires careful coordination across multiple teams and products.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Recent technical developments focus on improving agent functionality through payment infrastructure, dynamic prompt handling, entity-level security, and runtime reference enhancements, all contributing to the production-ready v2 objective.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize the integration of x402 payment infrastructure across the elizaOS ecosystem?
context: PR #6114 titled 'feat: x402 middleware' by @odilitime is open
Debate about storing x402 payment configurations in project initialization vs. character files

answer_1.text: Prioritize immediate integration with auto.fun to monetize agent creation and usage, driving token utility.
answer_1.implication: Creates direct revenue streams but may introduce friction in user growth if pricing is not carefully calibrated.

answer_2.text: Focus on developer experience by perfecting the payment middleware API and documentation before widespread implementation.
answer_2.implication: Builds stronger foundations for long-term adoption but delays immediate revenue opportunities.

answer_3.text: Implement a tiered rollout, starting with premium features while maintaining a generous free tier to balance growth with monetization.
answer_3.implication: Balances immediate value capture with user growth but increases implementation complexity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Which core runtime enhancements should be prioritized to most effectively advance our progress toward production-ready elizaOS v2?
context: PR #6113 titled 'feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts' by @odilitime is open
PR #6111 titled 'feat: add ElizaOS reference to runtime' by @standujar is open
PR #6107 titled 'feat: implement entity-level row level security' by @standujar is open

answer_1.text: Focus on agent reliability and performance optimizations through the dynamic prompt adjustment framework.
answer_1.implication: Improves end-user experience with existing agents but delays security and integration capabilities.

answer_2.text: Prioritize security and permissions through entity-level row security to enable enterprise and multi-tenant deployments.
answer_2.implication: Opens new market segments but may increase complexity for individual developers.

answer_3.text: Emphasize interoperability through unified messaging API and runtime references to create a more cohesive ecosystem.
answer_3.implication: Strengthens the platform aspects of elizaOS but risks delaying user-facing improvements.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What agent capabilities should be prioritized to showcase on auto.fun to most effectively attract new users?
context: Discussion about Puppeteer/Playwright for headless hardware-accelerated video encoding and streaming in containers
Issue #6127 titled 'Eliza Chat' by @borisudovicic is OPEN

answer_1.text: Focus on visual content generation and streaming capabilities to create attention-grabbing demonstrations.
answer_1.implication: Creates viral potential but requires significant technical infrastructure and may not showcase core elizaOS strengths.

answer_2.text: Prioritize financial utility through trading agents and DeFi integrations that deliver measurable value to users.
answer_2.implication: Appeals to crypto-native users but narrows the target audience and increases regulatory considerations.

answer_3.text: Emphasize conversational intelligence and personalization through enhanced chat capabilities and cross-platform presence.
answer_3.implication: Broadens appeal to non-technical users but faces intense competition from existing AI assistants.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: The community is actively discussing new agent launches, engagement mechanisms, and growth opportunities through AI events, while expressing concerns about high APY offerings and platform stability.

deliberation_items.text: How should we approach the balance between rapid agent deployment and ensuring quality/stability in our ecosystem?
context: Moca launching 10k Eliza agents (mentioned by Reneil)

Issue #6127 titled 'Eliza Chat' by @borisudovicic is OPEN: '* Debug and finalize agent chat responsiveness (speed, model routing).\n* Fix async model issues (switch to faster models via Groq / Kimi).\n* Ensure inference reliability and log monitoring.'

answer_1.text: Prioritize quantity and variety of agents to demonstrate ecosystem vibrancy, addressing quality issues iteratively post-launch.
answer_1.implication: Maximizes visibility but risks reputation damage if early experiences are negative.

answer_2.text: Establish rigorous quality standards and testing protocols before allowing mass agent deployment on the platform.
answer_2.implication: Ensures better user experiences but significantly slows growth and ecosystem expansion.

answer_3.text: Implement a tiered verification system that clearly distinguishes between experimental and production-ready agents while supporting both.
answer_3.implication: Balances innovation with quality but requires additional platform infrastructure and clear messaging.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What types of engagement systems would most effectively drive sustained user activity in our ecosystem?
context:
Issue #6128 titled 'Docs' by @borisudovicic is OPEN: '* Build new /docs UI (public, not auth-locked).
* Include:
  * OpenAI-style API explorer.
  * Character setup & API key usage examples.
  * Overview of Cloud architecture.'
AI events on Luma.com discussed as potential opportunities for user onboarding and investor presentations

answer_1.text: Implement gamification elements like points, badges, and leaderboards to reward active participation.
answer_1.implication: Creates short-term engagement but may not translate to meaningful ecosystem contribution.

answer_2.text: Prioritize educational resources and developer tooling to enable users to create their own agents and applications.
answer_2.implication: Builds stronger foundation for ecosystem growth but requires more effort from users to derive value.

answer_3.text: Focus on social and economic utility by enabling agent collaboration, delegation, and value-generating activities.
answer_3.implication: Aligns incentives with meaningful participation but requires more complex tokenomics and governance systems.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we address the technical infrastructure needs to ensure reliable 24/7 agent operations?
context: Issue #6130 titled 'Voice Infrastructure' by @borisudovicic is OPEN
Some users reported issues with ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites not working properly

answer_1.text: Invest in building proprietary high-reliability infrastructure to maintain full control over the stack.
answer_1.implication: Ensures consistency but diverts resources from core product development and increases operational overhead.

answer_2.text: Prioritize robust monitoring, fallback systems, and graceful degradation to handle failures in third-party services.
answer_2.implication: Maximizes resilience within budget constraints but creates dependencies on external providers.

answer_3.text: Develop a hybrid approach with critical components self-hosted while leveraging scalable cloud services for less critical functions.
answer_3.implication: Balances control with efficiency but increases architectural complexity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
